component.name: Tabs
component.description: Organize content into switchable tabbed panels for navigation within a view.

useCases: Switching between content sections within a page
Filtering views in dashboards or detail panels
Navigation within a card or panel without changing the URL
Vertical sidebar navigation with content panels

commonPatterns.name: horizontal-line-tabs
commonPatterns.description: Standard horizontal tabs with an underline indicator
commonPatterns.composition:
<Tabs defaultValue="overview" variant="line">
  <TabsList>
    <TabsTrigger value="overview">Overview</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="analytics">Analytics</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="settings">Settings</TabsTrigger>
  </TabsList>
  <TabsContent value="overview">...</TabsContent>
  <TabsContent value="analytics">...</TabsContent>
  <TabsContent value="settings">...</TabsContent>
</Tabs>

commonPatterns.name: pill-tabs
commonPatterns.description: Rounded pill-style tabs for compact section switching
commonPatterns.composition:
<Tabs defaultValue="all" variant="pill">
  <TabsList>
    <TabsTrigger value="all">All</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="active">Active</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="archived">Archived</TabsTrigger>
  </TabsList>
  <TabsContent value="all">...</TabsContent>
</Tabs>

antiPatterns.scenario: Using Tabs for primary page navigation
antiPatterns.reason: Tabs switch content within a view — they do not change the URL or route
antiPatterns.alternative: Use navigation links or a router-based navigation component

antiPatterns.scenario: Too many tabs overflowing the container
antiPatterns.reason: Excessive tabs break the layout and reduce scannability
antiPatterns.alternative: Consider a Select or DropdownMenu for more than 5–6 tabs

antiPatterns.scenario: Mixing tab variants within the same view
antiPatterns.reason: Inconsistent tab styles confuse the visual hierarchy
antiPatterns.alternative: Use a single variant per tab set; use different variants only at different hierarchy levels

semanticMeaning.line: Horizontal tabs with a bottom-border active indicator — default, most common
semanticMeaning.pill: Horizontal tabs with a rounded filled-background active state — compact, segmented feel
semanticMeaning.verticalLine: Vertical tabs with a right-side active indicator — for sidebar navigation layouts
semanticMeaning.verticalPill: Vertical tabs with a rounded filled-background active state — compact vertical variant

semanticMeaning.sm: Compact size — 11px text, tight padding for dense layouts

slots.TabsList: Container for the tab triggers — applies the variant layout styling
slots.TabsTrigger: Individual clickable tab — inherits variant and size from context or props
slots.TabsContent: Panel of content shown when its matching tab is active

parentConstraints: Variant and size can be set on the root Tabs component and are inherited via React context
Individual TabsTrigger or TabsList can override the inherited variant/size

interactions.click: Switches the visible content panel to match the selected trigger
interactions.hover: Text color shifts from muted-foreground to foreground
interactions.active-indicator: line: bottom border turns primary; pill: background fills with accent; verticalLine: right border turns primary

responsive.mobile: Horizontal tabs may need scroll; vertical tabs should be avoided on small screens
responsive.desktop: All variants work at full fidelity

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Arrow keys to navigate between tabs; Enter/Space to select; Home/End for first/last tab
accessibility.screenReader: Tab triggers announce role, label, and selected state; tab panels are associated via aria-controls
accessibility.focusManagement: Visible 2px focus ring on focus-visible; focus moves between triggers with arrow keys

rules: Use the line variant as the default for most horizontal tab layouts
Set variant and size on the root Tabs component — children inherit via context
Do not use Tabs for URL-based navigation — they switch in-view content only
Limit to 5–6 tabs maximum for scannability

aiHints.context: Use for switching between content sections within a single view. Default to variant="line" and size="md". Use vertical variants for sidebar-style settings navigation. Variant and size are inherited via context — set them on the root Tabs component.
